intro: Laportea anacardioides, commonly known as the stinging nettle tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 3–6 meters. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are heart-shaped with a rough, hairy texture. It is known for its stinging hairs on the leaves, which can cause skin irritation upon contact. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils.
